p: Several theories have been proposed regarding congenital cholesteatoma origin, including the ‘epithelial rest theory’ [ 10], the ‘invagination theory’ [ 22, 23], and the ‘implantation theory’ [ 9]. Although it remains unclear which theory best describes congenital cholesteatoma etiology, all theories insist that congenital and acquired cholesteatoma have different origins. Aquired cholesteatoma generally arise from a pars flaccida retraction pocket.
